title: How to Fold a Gum Wrapper Heart in 9 Simple Steps

steps.title: Remove the gum from the wrapper and lay the wrapper flat.
steps.content: Remove the gum from the wrapper and lay the wrapper flat. Place your gum wrapper on a solid surface and smooth out any creases and folds. [1] X Research source Gum that comes in long, rectangular wrappers, such as Wrigley’s and Extra, works best for making hearts. Both paper and foil gum wrappers work great for this craft.

steps.title: Turn the wrapper so it’s vertical and fold the long sides together.
steps.content: Turn the wrapper so it’s vertical and fold the long sides together. When you fold the long sides of the wrapper, the sides should meet together like you’re closing a book. Crease the fold to make a clear indent in the middle of the wrapper. Then unfold the wrapper. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the long, right side to the middle crease you just made.
steps.content: Fold the long, right side to the middle crease you just made. Let the edge of the wrapper just touch the crease. Then, fold the long, left side of the wrapper to the middle crease so that the right and left sides are touching. Crease each fold.

steps.title: Fold the top, right corner down so the point touches the middle crease.
steps.content: Fold the top, right corner down so the point touches the middle crease. The folded corner should make a right angle where the side and point meet the middle crease. Fold down the top left corner in the same way so that the folded corners touch at the crease. Crease the folds. The top end should now be folded into a pointed V shape.

steps.title: Fold the bottom, right corner down so the point meets the middle crease.
steps.content: Fold the bottom, right corner down so the point meets the middle crease. Then, fold down the bottom left corner to the middle crease. Crease the folds.

steps.title: Turn the wrapper so that the V points are horizontal and fold it in half.
steps.content: Turn the wrapper so that the V points are horizontal and fold it in half. When you fold the wrapper in half horizontally, the top and bottom V points should meet. Crease the fold to make a clear indent in the middle of the wrapper.

steps.title: Fold the right side up so that the V point is vertical.
steps.content: Fold the right side up so that the V point is vertical. The right side should meet the middle crease and create a point at the bottom of the wrapper. Crease the fold to keep the point in place.

steps.title: Do the same folds on the other side so that the left V point is vertical.
steps.content: Do the same folds on the other side so that the left V point is vertical. The left and right sides should now touch in the middle. Crease the fold. Your gum wrapper should be looking like a heart by now!

steps.title: To round out the heart, flip it over and fold the pointy corners down.
steps.content: To round out the heart, flip it over and fold the pointy corners down. Fold down the right point so that it touches the horizontal line created by the previous corner folds. Then, fold down the left point. Your gum wrapper heart is finished!
